Sent: Friday, November 27, 2020 10:24 AM
To: Mizuki Kojima <mailto:Mizuki@veldhoencompany.com>
Subject: Re: WordPress

Ah no that’s not me in the page, I came out of hubspot when I saw you accessing it.
The message below pops up to remind you it’s a translated page you’re accessing, so its ok to click ‘I understand – continue editing’

If I was working on it, you would see a message that says ‘Una has taken over’ or ‘Louise has taken over’ … that’s the message we would see if you were actively working on it too 😊

Re seeing the same format when editing, click the button ‘Back end editor’ which will give you the view we saw yesterday



You’ll then see this..



Cheers
Una

Morning Mizuki! 😊

How about starting with the page with the downloadable best practice paper:
https://www.veldhoencompany.com/en/work-transformation-best-practices-where-to-start/ <https://www.veldhoencompany.com/en/work-transformation-best-practices-where-to-start/>

I feel it would be ok to have the page is in Japanese, but the downloadable content in English. Let me know if that would work.

In terms of updating the page, its currently linked to another page on the site.

So all you need to do is access the page in wordpress…



Click on the wheels on the right hand side next to Japanese Translation, in order to update it



Then start to update the text that’s on the right hand side of the screen… Its simply linking to another page right now, which is the text you’ll see on the right, so it’s not translated.





Once that’s done, you’ll see your page under the Japanese section of the site; you can click to toggle to that from the main header at the top of the page, then select ‘posts’ and it will see the Japanese posts.



You can then access the page in Japanese and update the featured image – click update and choose this one from the library…



And update the SEO at the foot of the page



Let me know how you get on, and we can chat about updating the data capture form separately!

Cheers
Una
